intro: Ilex sieboldii, commonly known as the Japanese holly, is a deciduous evergreen shrub or small tree native to Japan. It belongs to the family Aquifoliaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that remain on the plant throughout the year. The plant produces small, red berries that are an important food source for birds and other wildlife. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Ilex sieboldii is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often used in landscaping for its dense foliage and year-round visual interest.
